div.a: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre:
83 Andritsaena, Elis, c. 1923 (49) Burial: c. - B.C. (T) Contents: 150+ AR Lot A Philip II: 10 lifetime and early post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 7, ANS 1944.100.12349 ANS 1944.100.12373 ANS 1944.100.12368 ANS 1944.100.12335 ANS 1944.100.12365 ANS 1944.100.12343 ANS 1944.100.12319 ANS 1944.100.12366
Pella 3 ANS 1997.9.75 ANS 1944.100.12216 ANS 1944.100.12251 ) Alexander III: 72 lifetime and early post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 22, ANS 1944.100.27772 ANS 1944.100.28647 ANS 1944.100.26821 ANS 1944.100.28661 ANS 1944.100.27516 ANS 1944.100.27576 ANS 1944.100.26689 ANS 1944.100.28220 ANS 1944.100.28524 ANS 1944.100.28642 ANS 1944.100.27558 ANS 1944.100.28629 ANS 1944.100.28255 ANS 1944.100.28523 ANS 1944.100.28628 ANS 1944.100.27538 ANS 1944.100.28681 ANS 1944.100.28615 ANS 1944.100.28622 ANS 1944.100.28562 ANS 1944.100.28581
Pella 6, ANS 1944.100.29351 ANS 1944.100.29362 ANS 1944.100.29373 ANS 1944.100.29340 ANS 1944.100.28681 ANS 1944.100.29368 ANS 1944.100.29342
unc. Macedon 2, ANS 1944.100.29522
Side 15, ANS 1944.100.33325 ANS 1944.100.33291 ANS 1944.100.33244 ANS 1944.100.33337 ANS 1944.100.33319 ANS 1944.100.33364 ANS 1944.100.33343 ANS 1944.100.33241 ANS 1944.100.33230 ANS 1944.100.33222 ANS 1944.100.33260 ANS 1944.100.33259 ANS 1944.100.33335 ANS 1944.100.33328 ANS 1944.100.33223 ANS 1944.100.33242

Babylon 8, imit. 1 ANS 1944.100.26649 )
Philip III: 2 tetradr. (Babylon) Boeotia: 3 st. Aegina: 18 st. (10 turtles, 8 tortoises) ANS 1957.172.1273
Sicyon: 2 st. Elis: 3 st.
Lot B Philip II: 12 lifetime and early post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 5, Pella 7) Alexander III: 27 lifetime and early post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 12, Pella 3, Sicyon 2, Side 2, Tarsus 2, Salamis 1, Myriandrus 2, Aradus 1, Damascus 1, Babylon 1) Philip III: 1 tetradr. (Babylon) Disposition: New York 85 (Philips and Alexanders of Lot A plus the Aegina illus. by Newell ex Hoyt Miller) ; Empedocles 39 (Lot B with one ex- ception); Seltman 3 (Elis of Lot A) Newell, NNM 21 (1923), 39 pp., illus. After Lot A had been published by Newell he learned of another 40 coins from the same hd. (39 acquired by Empedo- cles and 1 in trade). Among the post- humous Philips of Lot B is one described as having ΛΕ and bucranium. If this was part of the original hd., it may require lowering Newell's burial date of 315 B.C. by a few years For a third lot of coins, possibly part of this Andritsaena find, see "Tripolitsa," no. 84 below
